p: Regarding the colonization of new areas by P. caribaeorum, the temperate region of the northwestern Atlantic would see its suitable area increased under RCP 2.6 and 4.5, around Cape Hatteras and Chesapeake Bay. Zoanthids have the potential to disperse to great distances due to their long larval stage ( Ryland et al., 2000; Polak et al., 2011) and asexual reproduction ( Acosta, Sammarco & Duarte, 2005), alongside their potential to raft on floating objects and boats ( Santos et al., 2016). Thus, it is possible that the colonization of P. caribaeorum in the northwestern Atlantic would occur under these climate scenarios for hard bottom environments.
